intro: Collomia linearis f. unidentata, commonly known as the slender collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It is a perennial species with hairy leaves and produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. The subspecies unidentata is distinguished by its finely toothed leaf margins, setting it apart from other forms of Collomia linearis.
